00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 
00003 <h3>Install</h3>
00004 
00005 <p>
00006 
00007 Drop MiniBatteryStatus in /Library/Widgets/ in your home folder. Show Dashboard, click the Plus sign to display the Widget Bar and click the widget&rsquo;s icon in the Widget Bar to open it.
00008 
00009 </p>
00010 
00011 <h3>Usage</h3>
00012 <p>
00013 MiniBatteryStatus is already configured to start monitoring your laptop&rsquo;s primary battery. When the laptop is plugged, the widget will
00014 assume a deep blue color; moreover a small status icon tells you wheter the battery is just bypassed or it is charging. When you&rsquo;re running
00015 unplugged, the widget switches to color mode and changes from deep green (100% of charge) to deep red (0% of charge). Of course, in between
00016 you&rsquo;ll see literally thousands of different gorgeous gradations.
00017 </p>
00018 <p class="centered">
00019         <a href="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/arcoiris-realsize.png">
00020                 <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/arcoiris.png" alt="Virtually thousands of different colors" /></a>
00021 </p>
00022 <p>
00023 MiniBatteryStatus features four different visualizations. The default visualization is the remaining charge percentage.
00024 </p>
00025 <p class="centered">
00026         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/25.png" alt="Charge percentage visualization" />
00027 </p>
00028 <p>
00029 Click on the front of the widget to change the visualization to the remaining time. You may need to wait some time to allow the widget to calculate the time.
00030 </p>
00031 <p class="centered">
00032         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/26.png" alt="Remaining time visualization" />
00033 </p>
00034 <p>
00035 Click again to change the visualization to battery details. Here you can read the current and maximum capacity and the completed cycles.
00036 </p>
00037 <p class="centered">
00038         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/13.png" alt="Details visualization" />
00039 </p>
00040 <p>
00041 Click one last time to set the plain visualization. You will just see the translucent charge bar. Click again to start the cycle.
00042 </p>
00043 <p class="centered">
00044         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/19.png" alt="Empty visualization" />
00045 </p>
00046 
00047 <h3>Settings</h3>
00048 <p>
00049 You can change the settings by flipping the widget to show its back preference pane.
00050 
00051 On the back is also provided a button to give you quick access to the <strong>Energy Saver</strong> system preference pane.
00052 
00053 </p>
00054 
00055 <!-- General Settings -->
00056 
00057 <h3>General settings</h3>
00058 <p class="centered">
00059         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/general-preferences.png" alt="General Preferences" />
00060 </p>
00061 <ul>
00062 <li>
00063         <h4>Battery to monitor</h4>
00064         <p>
00065                 Some computers (like old Pismo&rsquo;s) have more than a battery. MiniBatteryStatus lets you choose which
00066                 battery to monitor. You can launch as many widgets as your computer batteries.
00067         </p>
00068         <p>
00069                 For your convenience, there&rsquo;s also a <strong>&ldquo;Demo&rdquo;</strong> mode to better
00070                 illustrate the behavior of the widget.
00071         </p>
00072 </li>
00073 <li>
00074         <h4>Check for updates</h4>
00075         <p>Allow the widget to automatically check if there is an available update (requires an internet connection).</p>
00076 </li>
00077 
00078 </ul>
00079 
00080 <!-- Growl Settings -->
00081 
00082 <h3>Growl settings</h3>
00083 <p class="centered">
00084         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/growl-preferences.png" alt="Growl Preferences" />
00085 </p>
00086 <ul>
00087 <li>
00088         <h4>Enable Growl notifications</h4>
00089         <p>Enables the communication between the widget and Growl event notification system. You may need to download and install Growl (<a href="http://www.growl.info" class="external">http://www.growl.info</a>) to use this feature.</p>
00090 
00091 </li>
00092 <li>
00093         <h4>Notify battery full</h4>
00094         <p>Enables an alert when your battery has been charged. Useful when you need to know when charge is over and you&rsquo;re busy doing something else.</p>
00095 </li>
00096 <li>
00097         <h4>Notify low battery</h4>
00098         <p>Whoops! This is really important. A customizable low battery threshold lets you decide when to be alerted when your battery is slowly dying.</p>
00099 </li>
00100 <li>
00101         <h4>Notify power source changes</h4>
00102         <p>Check this to be informed when your laptop switches from AC Power to Battery Power and vice versa.</p>
00103 </li>
00104 
00105 </ul>
00106 
00107 <!-- Sharing Settings -->
00108 
00109 <h3>Sharing settings</h3>
00110 <p class="centered">
00111         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/sharing-preferences.png" alt="Sharing Preferences" />
00112 </p>
00113 <ul>
00114 <li>
00115         <h4>Share battery data</h4>
00116         <p>
00117                 Start or stop the battery sharing daemon; it will make your battery data monitorable by
00118                 <a href="/software/macosx/minibatterylogger.html">MiniBatteryLogger</a>.
00119         </p>
00120         <p>
00121                 Additionally, your battery data will be sent to the <a href="http://burgos.emeraldion.it/mbl/">Battery Data Archive</a>,
00122                 a database that collects precious data to elaborate statistics, calculate medium battery life etc.
00123         </p>
00124 </li>
00125 </ul>
